author: Douglas Kyle
comment: This watch face has a lot of cool features with a lot of different color combinations and adjustments, and so far it has worked flawlessly even the heart rate displays as intended.

author: Ronald Mazyck
comment: I really like this watch face and customization options.

author: Vikas Jain
comment: Hi ,  I really like this watch face on my moto 360 sport , but only problem i am facing that it takes Steps data from Google fit & I dont have google fit on my  watch/phone.  I am using Moto Body app for fitness tracking , can anyone tell me how to change step data from google fit to moto body ?

author: Travis Meiss
comment: Nice looking, but it really kills the battery on my Moto 360 (2nd gen).  To clarify, I do not use the heart rate monitor and ambient mode is set to "eco".

reply.author: thema
reply.content: Sole options uses more battery, like the heart rate sensor and the ambient modes if not using "eco".

author: James Rittmeyer
comment: I absolutely love this watch face. Simple clean and looks great. Awesome functionality to boot. I just would request another Full Ambient Mode where it just displays the time (Ultra Eco).

author: Steven Goodwin
comment: Love this watch face. I would have given it 5 stars but the weather widget no longer works since upgrading to wear 2.0.  When you click on the weather icon it just says 'unable to execute shortcut'.  I have tried the usual restart etc. Same on LG G watch r and urbane 2 LTE.

reply.author: thema
reply.content: I released an update. You should be able to get it within a few minutes, depending on Googles deployment duration

author: Shamim Haghiri
comment: One of my fav watchfaces to date :) have one small issue I'm not sure how to fix though. When I tap weather widget on the bottom it opens a never ending loading screen. Can u plz help me fix this dev?!

author: Abhishek Anand
comment: It would be great to have an option to store the heart rate readings in local storage of the WATCH (not the phone) and transmit it to Google Fit periodically, say once a day.

author: Dini D Jefferson
comment: This is just what I want. BPM and calories on display. And I got to choose my own color. Hard to find.

author: Daryl Ford
comment: Needs a steps widget from Google fit.

reply.author: thema
reply.content: Hi. There is one. Just select the "step counter" data for any widget from the settings screen (hit the gear icon displayed over the watch face preview in the Android Wear app)

author: Chuck McCool
comment: Works great

author: Will Morris
comment: Great

author: josh p
comment: I really wish I could use this for my S3 Frontier.  I've tried everything I can think of and unable to view this.  Is there a plan to make this available for the S3
title: S3 Frontier

author: Jorge Osorio
comment: Overall is ok, but, weather widget does not interacts too well with phone app...
title: Average

author: Michael Williams
comment: Step count never updates

author: Colin Fitt
comment: Good face

reply.author: thema
reply.content:
The whole settings are located in the "Android wear" app of your mobile.
Just hit the gear icon over the watch face preview and the settings screen will show up ! EDIT: did it solve your issue?

title: Edited

author: Sean Bianchi
comment: It has what I was looking for in a watch face. Things it would need for me to give it a higher rating is 1. Disable the seconds tick marks. 2. More fonts. &  3. Maybe the option for bottom to be 2 options instead of one. Other than those 3 this is a great app watch face to have and will suggest it to my peeps.
title: Good

author: Damien Greaves
comment: Stop watch feature I great.
title: Great

author: Can Çiloğlu
comment: Great!
title: Exactly what I'm looking for

author: Danny Kirk
comment: I used this watch face for about 2 weeks. The designer thema answered my questions quickly. I was not getting step results on my Huawei watch and it was because I had to load Google fit on my phone. Everything worked. Very happy with this watch face. At first I thought the step count was off but it is not. It just takes some time for the steps to show. This is not the watch face's fault. Its a function of android. Nice to have heart rate and step count and the time turns into a stop watch at touch. Very nice. UPDATE: I found that I can use this watch face without google fit on my phone. Just had to Click on the google fit on my watch, scroll to the right past the heart rate, and make sure the fit app on the watch is set to on. Love this watch face.

author: Ken Adams
comment: Like the simple non cluttered design.   But as with a lot if these faces they do not support the latest Motor 360 Body app and the data needs to be better at accessing and updating when you select the icon.
title: Nice simple face for just what you need

author: Daniel Barnard
comment: It's a great face, both visually and practically. The battery consumption of the app on my phone, however, is quite bad. I'm really hoping battery consumption is minimised in future updates.

author: Joseph Loria
comment: Thema has done it yet again, combining a clean and uncluttered look that still oozes fashion. Impressive in its polish and function. This one has become my top watch face.
title: Another Winner

author: Wesley de Heer
comment: After less then a month of use this watchface causes burn-in on amoled watches... Ruined my display...
title: Causes burn-in

author: lee pike
comment: Been looking for a decent watch face with a working heartrate. Emailed for some advice on settings. Very fast response, massive 👍 up

author: Michael Staudt
comment: Face doesn't show in Android wear or anywhere on phone or watch. Moto 360 and galaxy s7 edge.

reply.author: thema
reply.content:
If you cannot see the watch face in your watch list, please go to Android Wear Application on mobile, open Settings and use Re-sync apps option.
If it does not work, please disconnect devices(watch and phone), uninstall the watch face, restart watch and connect device again. then finally install the watchface.

title: Help

author: Malarie Perelshteyn
comment: Love the customization abilities!
title: Great options

author: Darin Folckemer
comment: Very nicely done watch face. Excellent developer as well.

reply.author: thema
reply.content: I just released an update concerning weather, you should be able to get it within a few hours

title: Awesome

author: Cody Schadegg
comment: Only reason I don't give 5 stars is I would like to see interactivity with the widgets. Tap altitude and open maps for example, same battery indicator interactivity as your other faces. With that this face is perfect for me! *update-for me, perfect now!

reply.author: thema
reply.content: I just published a new release with interactivity features. Among them: detailed data on touch, switch data on touch, system apps shortcuts! It should be available soon, depending on Google's deployment duration

title: I actually love this face

author: Chris Hoopes
comment: This looks great on my LG Watch Urbane. Easy to read and set up. The stopwatch function is a nice feature. My favorite watch face by far!

reply.author: thema
reply.content: I just published a new release with interactivity features. Among them: detailed data on touch, switch data on touch, system apps shortcuts! It should be available soon, depending on Google's deployment duration

title: Favorite Watch Face

author: Jose Hernandez
comment: Allow to add/open any application installed in wear (i.e. wear messenger) from the widgets like the mini wear watchface does.
title: 1 request to make it 5 stars!

author: Stuart Rose
comment: Hate the 3 digits that go round need option to change design

author: Jennifer Michaleas
comment: Wanted digital watch with step counter. For some reason all the ones are not good ones. This one is the best one I have found.
title: Good one

author: Spencer Walker
comment: Runner was cool but no weather this watch face has it 5 stars
title: Awesome

author: Mehdi Cina
comment: I really like this watch face in its simplicity and ease of legibility. I would rate it 5 stars except the weather does not automatically update. It does update correctly when I restart the watch but then gets stuck at that reading no matter what I set the update interval to (15 minutes). As soon as I restart the watch, the correct temperature gets loaded. Edit: it does eventually update but not at the interval specified.
title: Nice watch face but weather won't update

author: Jason Cromes
comment: Looks great on my Moto 360 gen 1. Step count displays as zero unless Google Fit is enabled on the phone. Other faces work fine with only Moto Body enabled so its a slight inconvenience. Works well for running though, thanks.

reply.author: thema
reply.content: Steps are related to Google Fit only. In settings of the watch face on your MOBILE, did you approve the request to access the fitness data? Can you try install Google Fit app and see if it shows the steps count? You will need to activate history in it (like all google fit users do, on the first screen). GFit allows to agregate mob & watch data.

title: Looks great!

author: Daniel Marez
comment: Can't get the heart beat indicator to work stays at 49

author: Michael bagley
comment: Step not working

reply.author: thema
reply.content: Steps are related to Google Fit only. In settings of the watch face on your MOBILE, did you approve the request to access the fitness data? Can you try install Google Fit app and see if it shows the steps count? You will need to activate history in it (like all google fit users do, on the first screen). EDIT: dit it solve your issue?

title: 360 2ng

author: Justin Cates
comment: Great face - Moto360 2nd gen
title: Heart rate monitoring as often as 15s
